akn:subsection.akn:heading: When Noncompetitive Procedures May Be Used.—

akn:content.akn:p: (a) An executive agency may use procedures other than competitive procedures only when—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Property or Services Deemed Available From Only One Source.—

akn:content.akn:p: (b) For the purposes of subsection (a)(1), in the case of—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Property or Services Needed With Unusual and Compelling Urgency.—

akn:content.akn:p: (d) An executive agency using procedures other than competitive procedures to procure property or services by reason of the application of paragraph (2) or (6) of subsection (a) shall request offers from as many potential sources as is practicable under the circumstances.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Justification for Use of Noncompetitive Procedures.—
Public Availability of Justification and Approval Required for Using Noncompetitive Procedures.—
